Appendix................................................................................................................. 53 1  Introduction  Customers transitioning from the General Ledger to the Budget module for budget preparation need to set up reports to use the new parts of the database. This document details what tables and views are used to store the budget information used by the Budget module. Included is a brief review of how budget numbers are stored in the General Ledger, how the Budget module is structured, where the data is stored, and what tables and views can be used to create reports that retrieve information about entered budgets.  Intended Audience  This document assumes the reader has knowledge of EX Financials and of InfoMaker.   To learn more about those areas, check out the Learning and Development web pages on MyJenzabar.net ( https://www.myjenzabar.net/ICS/Learning__Development/ ). Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  2  General Ledger  Within the General Ledger, all account totals are stored in the GL_MASTER table, including the budget values. These amounts are tied directly to the Account Code, but the user can also work with account components. Budget amounts are stored in the ORIGINAL_BUD and CURRENT_BUD columns. Historical budget totals are stored in three BUD_HIST_YR columns. Future budgets are stored in five PROJ_BUD_YR columns. The BUD_PCT_MON values determine the percentage of the budget that applies to each fiscal month and are used for all years. Additional columns on the GL_MASTER table store totals and balances of various types.  Columns from GL_MASTER  GL_MASTER has one row per GL Account. Each row includes information about the account.  ACCT_CDE   ACCT_TYPE   OVRID_DESC FX_ACCT_TYPE   AVAILABLE_FOR_BUDGETING   Etc.  The following GL_MASTER columns are used in the General Ledger module for budgeting. When the Budget module is used for budgeting, these columns are no longer used. table are more columns with information about the account. When writing reports for General Ledger budgeting scenarios,   GL_MASTER   is the main table along with other tables or views that enforce GL Security ( GL_MASTER_SECURITY_VIEW ) and break out components ( GL_MASTER_COMP_V ) together with the tables that hold the account component values and their descriptions like   ACCT_COMP1_DEF   through   ACCT_COMP6_DEF . All of the table/views that deal with the accounts can be connected (joined) by the Account Code. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  4  Budgeting Module  Basic Concepts  Budgets, Worksheets and Line Items  In the Budget module, budgets are built using   line items . Each line item can have one or more GL Accounts associated with each it. These line items can then be grouped into one or more worksheets associated with the Budget. Worksheets can be broken out in as many descendant worksheets as needed and line items can be distributed appropriately. You can control worksheet access by assigning users to Budget specific roles and then granting those roles the appropriate level of access.  A master budget might break worksheets out by department components with the following hierarchy: Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  5  Budgets, Profiles, Profile Groups and Line Items  Profiles are also associated with a Budget. Profiles summarize line item information in ways that match or differ from Worksheets. Line items can be grouped into Profile Groups, which are part of a Profile. A line item may only be associated with a single Profile Group within a Profile. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  6  It is possible to create multiple Profiles with Profile Groups to meet various summarization needs.  GL Actuals Data  When using the Budget module, the current and historic account balances are still stored in the GL_MASTER table. GL_MASTER columns are referenced and summarized in database views. These views provide totals of the account balances at the LineItem, Worksheet or ProfileGroup level. It is NOT necessary to include the GL accounts in a report unless you want to see that level of detail in the report in addition to what the views provide.  Using Views to Access Data  The Budget tables are normalized (providing a separate row for each occurrence of a specific type of data) and thus all objects (budgets, worksheets, line items, etc.) are identified by IDs (sequential numbers), which can make it difficult to pull the information back together for reporting. To address this issue, a number of views have been created to collect the data elements that are associated into views. The view names are referenced here. See the view definitions in SQL Server Management Studio, the descriptions in the Appendix of this document, or the Tables & Columns topic in EX Help to see how the data elements are brought together. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  7  For many views that include information about budgets, worksheets, profiles, budget or balance data, there are also   secured versions   that can be used in reports to restrict users to only the data they are allowed to see. See the   How the Secured Views Work   section below for more information.  Information Views  Names of the secured versions of the views in this list are in parentheses.  MasterBudgetV (MasterBudgetSecV)  The   MasterBudgetV   and   MasterBudgetSecV   view information includes the begin date and end date, description, period type, budget type, and budget status of Master Budgets that have been defined.  WorksheetV (WorksheetSecV)  The   WorksheetV   and   WorksheetSecV   view information include the worksheet name, the ID and name of the MasterBudget with which it is associated, and the worksheet status of Worksheets that have been defined.  LineItemInformationV (LineItemInformationSecV)  The   LineItemInformationV   and   LineItemInformationSecV   include, for each LineItem defined, the period index, original and current amount for the period, the LineItemCode and description, the Worksheet ID and Description with which the LineItem is associated, and the MasterBudget ID and name for the Master Budgets with which the LineItem is associated. (LineItems can be associated with multiple MasterBudgets so knowing the Worksheet or Profile and MasterBudget info is critical.)  BudgetProfileGroupLineItemV (BudgetProfileGroupLineItemSecV)  The   BudgetProfileGroupLineItemV   and   BudgetProfileGroupLineItemSecV   include the BudgetProfile ID and Name, the BudgetProfileGroup ID and Name, the LineItemID for LineItems included in the BudgetProfileGroup and the MasterBudgetID for the MasterBudget with which the BudgetProfileGroup is associated for each BudgetProfileGroup that has been defined. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  8  Other Useful Views  LineItemAmountPivotV (LineItemAmountPivotSecV)  The LineItemInformationV and LineItemInformationSecV have one row per period. Many times you need one row per LineItem with the period amounts all on that row. This is provided in   LineItemAmountPivotV   and   LineItemAmountPivotSecV . It also includes the LineItem ID, the LineItemCode ID, the MasterBudget ID and Worksheet ID as well as the PeriodType, Justification and from which LineItem this one is descended.  LineItemsWithGLAcctsV  To tie together the LineItems with the GL_MASTER accounts that are associated with them, there is a view   LineItemsWithGLAcctsV   that includes LineItem information, the GL_MASTER account code and description, and a formatted Account code, which is provided for use by reporting tools other than InfoMaker that can't automatically apply the formatting mask. This formatted Account code column uses the database  dbo.fnAccountCode$Format   function to format the account code. The LineItemsWithGLAcctsV view uses the table   GLLineItemXRef   that matches the GeneralLedger ID with the LineItem ID. Use the LineItemsWithGLAcctsV view in your reporting when you want line items even if they do not have accounts associated with them. There is no corresponding secured view for this one as security is handled by another view joined to it.  GLAcctsWithLineItemsV  The   GLAcctsWithLineItemsV   view gives a list of all the GL accounts that are marked as Available for Budgeting and associated with line items. It includes the same columns as the LineItemsWithGLAcctsV view but in a different order. Use this view when you are starting with GL account information and want corresponding line item information. There is no corresponding secured view for this one as security is handled by another view joined to it.  Useful Table  ,  GeneralLedger  The   GeneralLedger   table contains the GL account code and the account components, but has a primary key of an ID instead of the account code so it can be connected to the other budget tables/views using the GL Account ID. It always has the same accounts as GL_MASTER and can be used when you want to work with your accounts using the account components. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  9  Summary Views  There are additional views that summarize the GL Master Balance columns for the accounts that are associated with each line item, etc. These summary views are built using the cross reference table and views. If you use these views, you do not have to include all the line items or GL accounts and summarize in the reporting tool. All the summary information for each level is available at that level. There is no summary view for the Master Budget or Profile level. You can get this info by referencing the Master Worksheet for the Master Budget or by summing the line item values for that grouping in a report.  LineItemSummaryInfoV (LineItemSummaryInfoSecV)  The LineItemSummaryInfoV and LineItemSummaryInfoSecV include:  •   LineItem, Worksheet, MasterBudget, and PeriodType information  •   Summaries of the Original and Current Budget amounts for each period  •   Summaries of months 1 - 12 of the GL_MASTER Encumbrance balances for the current and future years, and for History years 1 and 2  •   Summaries of history balances for History years 1 and 2  •   Summaries of posted balances for current and future years  •   Summaries of unposted balances for current and future years  •   Summaries of posted balances from GL_MASTER_EXT  •   Summaries of Balance History years 3, 4, and 5 If each LineItem is associated with only one GL Account, then the summarized balances for a LineItem in LineItemSummaryInfoV match the balances in GL_MASTER for the corresponding account. If a LineItem has multiple accounts associated with it, then the summarized balances for that LineItem in LineItemSummaryInfoV should match the sum of the balances in GL_MASTER for the corresponding accounts.  WorksheetSummaryInfoV (WorksheetSummaryInfoSecV)  The WorksheetSummaryInfoV and WorksheetSummaryInfoSecV include:  •   Worksheet, Master Budget and PeriodType information  •   Summaries for the Original and Current Budget amounts for each period  •   Summaries for months 1 - 12 of the GL_MASTER Encumbrance balances for the current and future years, and for History year 1 and 2  •   Summaries of history balances for History year 1 and 2  •   Summaries of posted balances for current and future year  •   Summaries of unposted balances for current and future year  •   Summaries of posted balances from GL_MASTER_EXT  •   Summaries of Balance History Years 3, 4, and 5 Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Higher   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  10  BudgetProfileGroupSumInfoV (BudgetProfileGroupSumInfoSecV)  The BudgetProfileGroupSumInfoV and BudgetProfileGroupSumInfoSecV include:  •   BudgetProfileGroup, Master Budget, and PeriodType information  •   Summaries for the Original and Current Budget amounts for each period  •   Summaries for months 1 - 12 of the GL_MASTER Encumbrance balances for the current and future years, and for History years 1 and 2  •   Summaries of history balances for History years 1 and 2  •   Summaries of posted balances for current and future years  •   Summaries of unposted balances for current and future years  •   Summaries of posted balances from GL_MASTER_EXT  •   Summaries of Balance History years 3, 4, and 5  How the Secured Views Work  Security in the Budget module is controlled by limiting user access to the worksheets. The WorksheetSecV view includes tests to identify the USER_ID of the user currently running the report, the program within which the report is being run (EX, InfoMaker, Reporting Services, MSS Management Studio, etc.), and compares them to values in the tables/views in EX with which the EX security is managed. Other secured views in the Budget module include the WorksheetSecV and apply the worksheet security to the related components (e.g., master budgets, line items, profiles, and profile groups). It is highly recommended that reports be created using secured views so that various users can use the same report and see only the worksheets, line items, budgets, profiles, and profile groups to which they have access. Secured views do not currently work in JICS. 11  Examples  The following examples incorporate the concepts and database tables and views discussed above. This section assumes the reader has InfoMaker knowledge and experience.  Completed examples of the following reports can be found in the Budget Module Resource Center ( https://www.myjenzabar.net/ICS/Support/EX/Module_Support/Budget.jnz )  in a pbl designed to accompany this document. Both unsecured and secured versions are included.  Create a New Report –Budget to Actual Report  The original report demonstrates a report written to extract Budget values from GL Master and compare them to the Current and YTD Actuals to gain insight into the current standing. The Budget module version of a similar report extracts the Budget and Actual values from the Budget tables/views.  Original Report  Preview of the report: There are no Budget values available in GL Master for this fiscal year because they have been entered in the Budget module into worksheets for the current Operating Budget. Identify the budget to be used and worksheets that contain similar sets of accounts. In this example, we are looking at the   Science & Math – Biology – 12103   worksheet in the   2012-2013 Operating Budget 3 . We are exploring the views that contain information we want included in the report.  In Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, these queries use mixed case table and view names. In InfoMaker, these queries use all lower case because of InfoMaker settings.  MSS Management Studio   InfoMaker  SELECT   WorksheetSecV . ID ,  WorksheetSecV . WorksheetName ,  WorksheetSecV . MasterBudgetStatusID  FROM   WorksheetSecV SELECT worksheetsecv.id, worksheetsecv.worksheetname, worksheetsecv.masterbudgetid, worksheetsecv.masterbudgetname,  worksheetsecv .masterbudgetstatusid  FROM worksheetsecv Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  15  2. To have this report secured based on the user running the report, use the  WorksheetSecV   view. Be sure to use a login with Budget module permissions to some worksheets in order to retrieve data (i.e., not TE_ADMIN, TE_PGMR, or SA). This example uses the secured views. To find information about the   2012-2013 Operating Budget 3,   access the  MasterBudgetSecV   view (or   MasterBudgetV ).  5.   In this example, the budget name, date range, period type, and budget status are being used. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  17  6. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  18  7.   Note there is one row here for each budget period therefore a monthly budget has 12 rows for each line item. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  19  8.   To see all the budget amounts on one row per line item, access the  LineItemAmountPivotSecV   (or   LineItemAmountPivotV ) view. This example shows all the original and current budget amounts as well as enough other information to identify the line items. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  20  9.   This provides one row per line item.  10.   To get summarized current balances from the GL accounts that are associated with these line items, use the   LineItemSummaryInfoSecV   (or   LineItemSummaryInfoV)  view. If you have associated only one GL account with a line item, then the values match those in GL_MASTER. If you have multiple accounts associated with one line item, then the GL amounts are summed to get the summary balances for the line item. This view also contains all the budget values included in LineItemAmountPivotSecV (or LineItemAmountPivotV.) Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  21  11.   This view provides one row per line item with the budget values and all the actual values that are available in GL_MASTER.  12.   To see the GL accounts associated with the line items, use the  LineItemsWithGLAcctsV   view. (There is no corresponding secured view. Security is managed by joining the   LineItemsWithGLAcctsV view to another secured view.) Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  22  13.   The   FormattedGLMasterAcctCode   column in this view is formatted using  dbo.fnAccountCode$Format   and can be used outside of EX/InfoMaker.  14.   By using the   LineItemsWithGLAcctsV   view, you can join to   GLMasterSecV   if you need other information about the GL accounts. (Or you can use   GL_MASTER   if you are not securing your data.) Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  23  15.   To view summary information summarized at the worksheet level, select the  WorksheetSummaryInfoSecV   view (or   WorksheetSummaryInfoV .) WorksheetV can be used in addition to the summary view in the report to include other worksheet information.  16.   To view the accounts associated with line items and balance columns per account (not budget amounts), add the corresponding columns from   GLMasterSecV   (or  GL_MASTER ). Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  24  Creating a Query  1.   You can create a budget report that prompts for a worksheet and a fiscal period and, for a defined budget, displays information about the worksheet and all the line items in the worksheet. To include the line item code, the line item description, the actuals balance (posted +unposted) for the fiscal period, the actuals year to date balance (posted + unposted) as of the fiscal period, the total current budget for the line item, the amount left in the budget, and a forecasted annual actual amount (year to date actuals plus the sum of the budget amounts for the remaining periods) use the following views:  WorksheetSecV MasterBudgetSecV WorksheetSummaryInfoSecV LineItemSummaryInfoSecV  To include account information, add the following, though they are not needed to get the actual balances for the line items:  LineItemsWithGLAcctsV GLMasterSecV  In order to know which account balance columns to use, you need to know whether this budget is associated with the GL Current or Future year. Assuming that the budget begins at the start of a fiscal year, you can create a computed object that compares the Year part of the budget From Date to the Current Year value in the GL_CONFIG table. If it matches, then the Current year columns are used, if not, the Future year columns are used. Add the   GL_CONFIG   table and the CUR_YR and FISCAL_YR_BEGIN_MO columns. Criteria can be added to the where clause to restrict this report to Operating budgets that start at the beginning of the fiscal year and are associated with either the Current or Future year. Hard code the ID of the budget being used in this report. ( TIP:   You can create a retrieval argument, but users need to know it to run the report. Since this ID changes infrequently, you can just include it in the Select statement and modify it when the referenced budget changes.)  (   (   worksheetsecv.masterbudgetid   =   18   )   AND (   masterbudgetsecv.budgettypeid   =   -1   )   AND (   datepart(mm,   masterbudgetsecv.fromdate)   =   gl_config.fiscal_yr_begin_mo   )   AND (datepart(yyyy,   masterbudgetsecv.fromdate)   =   gl_config.cur_yr   OR datepart(yyyy,   masterbudgetsecv.fromdate)   =   gl_config.cur_yr   +   1)   )  Computed columns can also be added to provide the Period Begin Date and Period End Date. Testing and calculations must be done in the computed column as budgets can have period types of Year, Quarter, or Month. A computed column can also be added to identify which database the report is running against. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  25  2.   The following demonstrates an InfoMaker query with these views, criteria, and computed columns. This query can be saved to use as the data source for the report.  3. (Details can be found in the accompanying pbl):  •   Actuals   (posted & unposted) for the   fiscal period  •   Encumbrances   for the   fiscal period  •   Actuals year to date   (posted & unposted) through the fiscal period  •   Encumbrances year to date   through the fiscal period  •   Total current budget   for the line item  •   Amount remaining   in the budget (current budget – (ytd actuals + ytd encumbrances))  •   Forecasted annual actual amount   (ytd actuals + ytd encumbrances + the sum of the budget amounts for the remaining months) instead of a variance percentage These will be created on the worksheet and line item levels. Values in the TreeView levels are NOT summed from the detail band since they have been calculated in the views.  •   The worksheet level objects will use columns from   worksheetsummaryinfosecv  (or worksheetsummaryinfov) and will test the   current_future   and   reportperiod  values to determine which columns to display and/or sum.  •   The line item level objects will use columns from   lineitemsummaryinfosecv   (or lineitemsummaryinfov) and will test the   current_future   and   reportperiod   values to determine which columns to display and/or sum.  •   The   Period   and   YTD Actuals   and   Encumbrances   computed objects can also be created on the account level as well using columns from GLMasterSecV GL_MASTER (or GL_MASTER) and will also test the   current_future   and   reportperiod   values to determine which columns to display and/or sum. 18. WARNING:   This method will ONLY work if you have associated EACH Line Item with ONLY ONE Account.  To accommodate customized versions of the GL Trial Balance report that include budget amounts, the following example demonstrates a   temporary work around   until new customized reports are available. Budget values are retrieved from the Line Items and are only correct if each line item is associated with a single account. The same method could be used to modify customized Variance reports though it is recommended that the default Budget to Actual Worksheet report and/or the default Budget to Actual Profile report be used or customized instead.  Original Report  The EX Trial Balance report shows the current posted balance values for accounts as of the end of a month to allow users to verify that credits and debits are in balance. It also displays budget values as additional information. When the report is generated within EX, the window prompts for the Current/Future Year and the Fiscal Month to determine the summary values to be retrieved. Jenzabar EX 4.3 or Later   Budget Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  45  The budget and actuals values come from the GL_MASTER table. Reporting – Transitioning from GL to BG  48  Modifying the Report to include Budget Module Data  You may want to modify this report so that the budget values come from the  LineItemSummaryInfoSecV   (or   LineItemSummaryInfoV ) and it continues to retrieve all accounts. Once the new SQL statement is created, the computed objects that display the budget values must be updated. Use secured views to restrict the user to only those accounts and line items that they have permission to see within EX.  Modified SQL Select  In the modification of the SQL Select statement the following need to be done: 1.   Add the   LineItemSummaryInfoSecV   view to access the Budget columns. Since the budgeting is done by fiscal period instead of year, these columns are added together to get the total LineItemCurrentBudget. 2.   Add the   GLAcctsWithLineItemsV   view which connects the line items to the accounts. 3.   Add a UNION section to retrieve accounts that are not associated with line items. (Remember that both parts of a union must have an equal number and corresponding columns. If you change one part, change the other as well.) 4.   Verify that only those line items that are associated with the budget from which we are retrieving the budget data are viewable by setting the Master Budget ID. Including Non-Budget Accounts in BG Reports  If you have a Budget to Actual report based on Budget module tables and views in which you would like to also see the actuals for accounts not budgeted, try this method. Test first on the Play database. You can use the EX default Budget to Actual Worksheet and Budget to Actual Profile reports for testing. 1.   Mark all non-budget accounts you want to track as   Available for Budgeting   so they show up in the Budget module. 2.   Create one or more worksheet(s) labeled as Non-Budget Accounts in your budget and add the non-budget accounts to the new worksheet(s). 3.   Grant only   View   access to the budget officers of the non-budget worksheet(s) except for the Administrator so no one accidently adds budget information. (You need to have one budget officer for a worksheet that has more than View access.) 4.   Examine these worksheets and/or the Master Worksheet for the budget. 5.   (Optional)   Create one or more Profile Groups to group budget and non-budget line items together and examine them using a report based on Profiles rather than Worksheets. 53  Appendix  The tables and views below are those used by the Budget module to store and manage data and to gather together associated data for easier data retrieval.
